ENGLISH: The call has come for Tabasco to join Yucatán, a union of two brother-states which will tend to the needs of their people.
Incorporation of Tabasco

We will remain independent.

$FROMCOUNTRY$ Has Refused

Wyke-Aycinena Convention of $YEAR$

Our foreign minister Pedro de Aycinena y PiÃ±ol has negotiated a deal with British Consul Charles Lennox Wyke. In exchange for our acknowledgement that the territory between the Belize and Sarstoon Rivers is a part of the British settlement, and not $COUNTRY$, the British will allow us to purchase needed weapons and to build a road between Ciudad de Guatemala and Belize Town to improve communication with our Atlantic coast.
An Atlantic connection would greatly boost our trade!
I don't think we'll ever get that road.
Sell Fort Ross to the Mexican citizen John Sutter?
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has agreed to sell the Fort Ross trading post to us! Long live $COUNTRY$!

The British have come forth to us with a proposal to settle the border between our state of Yucatan and their colony of Belize. In order to prevent future conflict and the native encroachment on our respective territories, they propose that we set the border at the Rio Hondo river. While this would mean we would be renouncing some territorial claims, this treaty would also help us bring the problem of the rebellious Maya in Yucatan under control.
The Belize-Yucatan Border
No. That land is rightfully ours.
We cannot afford for this to escalate.
The Mexicans have refused our generous offer. Our only recourse is force of arms.
Mexico has refused!
Our military could use the target practice.
We don't need this to come to a war yet.

The Hay-Herbert Treaty has set up an arbitration tribunal with equal membership from all sides to determine which nation's claims in Alaska are to be honoured, and now the tribunal has reached a decision in favour of:
Hay-Herbert Treaty
The tribunal finds in favor of $FROMCOUNTRY$.
The tribunal finds in favor of $COUNTRY$.
It is not what we expected, but we accept the tribunal's decision.
Alaska Arbitration Tribunal of $YEAR$
We thought they were our friends.
As expected, the tribunal was flawed from the beginning.
Alaska Arbitration Tribunal of $YEAR$
Our friendship with our neighbour is over.

The Belgian Government has come to us with an offer to lease the territory of Santo Tomás de Castilla to the Compagnie belge de colonisation under the protection of King Leopold I of Belgium. The land is currently sparsely populated, mostly by natives, and they wish to establish a settlement there. While some view the issue pragmatically - the land is unused, and the money from the lease and connections to an European market would help our economy - others feel like it is a betrayal of the independence that was fought over not one generation ago.
A Belgian Colony in Guatemala?
What do we care for a swamp inhabited only by a few natives?
We did not throw off the Spanish so that we could invite the Belgians!
The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has accepted our proposal of an indefinite lease on the territory.
A Belgian Colony in Guatemala?
Send the settlers our, we will make Santo Tomás our own
On second thought, we would rather spend the money elsewhere

Mexican troops have marched to the border at Soconusco and we have received an ultimatum from the Mexican government: leave Soconusco or face war. Can we fight this war? The Texan rebellion certainly showed the weaknesses of the Mexican army, especially in difficult terrain, but our numbers are few and our forces undersupplied.
Mexico threatens Soconusco
There is nothing we can do - send the garrison home.
We will defend our territorial integrity!

Disease has wrecked the colony of Santo Tomás! Many of our settlers have already perished and the crops are failing. Many of the original investors in the colony are losing interest and liquidating their assets. If the colony is to continue, we would have to buy out the plantations and infrastructure and invest more into making the colony viable long-term. But is it worth it, for a few coffee beans?
For a few coffee beans more?
Buy them out and reinvest in the colony. The cash crops will pay for themselves.
Cut our losses and abandon the colony.

Disease has wrecked the colony of Santo Tomás. The Belgian settlers, those that survived, are returning to Belgium, and the settlements and plantations lie abandoned. While the lease of the land was perpetual, it doesn't look like they will be coming back.
The Belgians abandon Santo Tomás
Oh well..
The treaty of Vienna.
We have utterly crushed the Hungarians in battle and need to decide how far we want to go with our cause. The other Great Powers are watching.
Only take the German border regions
Take the German border regions and free Banat!

Free everyone and make Hungary a client kingdom under the Habsburgs!
The fate of Slovakia and Ruthenia

Now that we are in the process of setting up Hungary as a client Kingdom under the Habsburgs, Slovak and Ruthenian leaders have approached us and ask to be granted their own States rather than stay part of Hungary.
Hungary has been carved up enough already.

The Freistaat Banat

Ever since the early 1700s Germans from mainly Lorraine have been settling in the areas of Banat and Vojvodina. When Germany recently unified with the Austrian Empire the Region was left to Hungary without any guarantee for protection of the German minorities and their culture. A grave mistake which eventually lead to war between the newly formed German Empire and Hungary which, among other things, concluded in the formation of the Freistaat Banat.

The Freistaat Siebenbuergen

In the 12th century King Geza II of Hungary (reigned 1141-62) invited Germans to settle and defend relatively sparsely populated Transylvania. Ever since then Transylvania, known as Siebenbuergen to its German settlers, had a sizeable German minority. When Germany recently unified with the Austrian Empire the Region was left to Hungary without any guarantee for protection of the German minorities and their culture. A grave mistake which eventually lead to war between the newly formed German Empire and Hungary which, among other things, concluded in the formation of the Freistaat Siebenbuergen.
Interesting
The return of the Habsburgs

Despite being nominally still ruled by the Habsburg Monarch for a long time after its independence, said King never had true power over "his" government ever since Hungary seperated from Austria. With the conclusion of the war with Germany the Habsburgs were returned to true power in Hungary, as a proxy for the interests of the newly formed greater Germany of course. Since the von Habsburg Monarch also rules the Archduchy of Austria within the German Empire the fate of Hungary is tied to that of Germany as long as this arrangement lasts.
As it should be

Germans in Hungary

The region of Burgenland and the City of Pressburg are populated by mostly Germans. Furthermore the fertile farmlands of Banat and the mountains of Transylvania have sizeable German minoritys that have been settling there for centuries. Our goal should be to unite Burgenland and Pressburg with Germany and create states for the German settlers in Banat and Transylvania. In addition to this the von Habsburg Family has asked us to use this opportunity to restore their candidate for the Hungarian throne to absolute power. This would make Hungary a clientstate for all intends and purposes.
The game begins!

Germany and Hungary at the table in Temeschburg

The Freistaat Siebenbürgen

In the 12th century King Geza II of Hungary (reigned 1141-62) invited Germans to settle and defend relatively sparsely populated Transylvania. Ever since then Transylvania, known as Siebenbuergen to its German settlers, had a sizeable German minority. As part of our larger effort to diplomatically solve the issue of the Germans in Hungary we have managed to secure the creating of the Freistaat Siebenbürgen, an autonomous state within Hungary for the Germans and Romanians of Transylvania.

The Habsburg proposal

The current head of the Habsburg Family has approached us with a daring plan to take back what is, in his eyes, rightful property of his family. He suggests to provoke a war within Hungary, between the central government and one of the new Freistaaten to be precise, in which we would then intervene. He expects no direct international intervention but does acknowledges that we will be viewed as the real aggressors here not matter what the treatys say. Other voices keen on saving face internationally and limiting Habsburg power within the Empire have proposed we provoke an incident but only to demand formal control over the Freistaaten whilst avoiding a direct war. Some even say to let off altogether and just proceed to just settle the last few questions between us and Hungary.
Lets go with the Habsburg Plan
Only free the Freistaaten
We have won enough already
War in Banat!
Banat is in de facto open rebellion. They have declared allegiance to Germany and are preparing to fight us. We need to restore order quickly before the Situation escalates into all out war.
Lets hope this isnt a mistake
War in Banat!

The security forces of Banat have, as per our orders, provoked a detachement of the Hungarian Army to cross the border into the autonomous Freistaat by secretly setting fire to a Hungarian village right within the view of said Platoon. After the Hungarians were done with helping to put out the fires the Banatian Troops arrested the whole Platoon claiming Hungary is testing the waters on how far they can push around Banat. After some back and forth that, also as per our orders, went nowhere, the situation escalated with Hungary now trying to occupy the Freistaat to restore order to their rougue province. They claim this is within their right as Banat is DeJure still part of Hungary.
This is in breach of our treaty! We must save Banat!
War in Hungary!

Hungary went to war against Germany and Banat after a border incident involving Hungarian troops being arrested after illegaly crossing into the Freistaat Banat. We must mobilise our own security forces and support our bretheren!
Death to Hungary!
Victory!

We have achieved total Victory in our war against Hungary. Banat and Siebenbürgen have been incorporated into the German Empire as autonomous Freistaaten and the Habsburg King is on his way to be installed as Absolute Ruler of Hungary, making them little more than our client state.
The best possible outcome of the Great Game!
The first issue
To begin our last treaty with Hungary, we first have to decide what to do with the German populations living around the Hungarian Capital area.
Force Hungary to grant them special rights and protections
Resettle them to the Freistaaten
A cunning plan

The Slovak and Ruthenian leaders have approached us with a request. They ask that we carve out state of their own from the defeated Hungary as part of the coming treaty with the new Hungarian government. Whilst we dont care much for for the particular fate of their small nations, several figures in our government have suggested granting them their request to weaken the Habsburg family and Hungary itself.
We shall consider it
The second issue

The Plan of the Carpatho Slav leaders is taking shape. The would be governments of their new States, The Kingdom of Nitra and the Kingdom of Carpatho-Ruthenia, have already defined their mutual borders and reached out for candidates fit to become their Kings: Prominent Members of Houses of Wittelsbach and Urach respectively. All they need now is us to sign them into existence.
Lets rather not
Lets do it
The third issue

Hungary was completely steamrolled by the German army and is completely at our mercy. We should use this opportunity to expand the Borders of the Freistaaten to their greatest possible extent if we havent achieved that during the negotiations already.
No. The current borders work well for us.
Lets go through with that as well!
The Game is over

After long years of slogging Negotiations and a few months of war, all our Goals in Hungary have been achieved. With the Freistaaten and our Dominion over Hungary proper we have ensured that German influence remains in the Region even after the end of the Austrian Empire. Glory to the German Empire!
Good Game, Well Played
Banat at the brink of war, again

Our troops have crossed the border into the territory of the Freistaat Banat. Allegedly they have been baited into doing this by Freistaat Soldiers yet we do not have concrete proof. Nonetheless we are faced with a difficult decision to make as Freistaat security forces have arrested our soldiers on the spot and the local government has declared allegiance to Germany. Similar motions have been set into movement in transylvania. If we want to keep Banat and Transylvania war if inevitable. We could however just hand over the Freistaaten.
War it is!
Hand over the Freistaaten
Banat is in de facto open rebellion. They have declared allegiance to Germany and are preparing to fight us. We need to restore order quickly before the Situation escalates into all out war.

The security forces of Banat have, as per our orders, provoked a detachement of the Hungarian Army to cross the border into the autonomous Freistaat by secretly setting fire to a Hungarian village right within the view of said Platoon. After the Hungarians were done with helping to put out the fires the Banatian Troops arrested the whole Platoon claiming Hungary is testing the waters on how far they can push around Banat. After some back and forth that went nowhere, the situation escalated with Hungary now trying to occupy the Freistaat to restore order to their rougue province. They claim this is within their right as Banat is DeJure still part of Hungary.
Hungary offers the Freistaaten

The Hungarians have seen the writing on the wall and have offered to hand over the Freistaaten to our control. This marks the turning point in the Great Hungarian Game as most have expected for it to end in either local war or, at worst, conflict with Russia.
Peace in our time.
The first issue

To begin our last treaty with Hungary, we first have to decide what to do with the German populations living around the Hungarian Capital area. Hungary asks for an exchange of populations yet noone really insists on anything here.
The Status quo is just fine to us.
Resettle them to the Freistaaten
The second issue

Now that everything is settled and done, many people on both sides ask for a unified border treaty that defines the borders between Germany, Hungary and the Freistaaten. The multitude of treatys and meetings during the last few years could easily be unified into one single treaty if we wished to do so.
The current situation suits us just fine
Lets draw up the treaty
The Game is over

After long years of slogging Negotiations the Hungarian issue has finnally concluded, and without a war at that. With the newly established Freistaaten and the gained border territory from Hungary the right of most German settlers in Hungary are protected. The Habsburg family is a bit sour that we didnt push for their restoration to power over Hungary yet they dont hold a grudge as its revealed most of them didnt belive it possible anyways.
Politics is always a compromise
Moving the Game Forward

The negotiations are coming to an end. We have pushed as hard as we could for what we wanted to achieve. However some more radical elements demand we provoke war with Hungary in one of the Freistaaten in order to have their overlordship transferred to us.
No, lets just settle the matter and focus on other things
Lets see what we can achieve!
Violence in Siebenbürgen!

Fighting between Freistaat forces and the remaining Hungarian Army has broken out all over Siebenbürgen! The Siebenbürger Government has declared its alliegance to Germany rather than Hungary! We now stand at a crossroads. We could either hand over Overlordship of the Freistaat to Germany and completely withdraw from the Freistaat or Invade to restore order. The latter of which will mean conflict with Germany for sure.
Invade the Freistaat!
We have no choice but to concede.
Hungary invades!
Hungarian Army detatchments not previously meant to be stationed in Siebenbürgen have crossed the borders! Hungary is trying to beat us back into submission!
To Arms! .... And call for German aid!
War in Siebenbürgen!

After our previous provokations the situation in Siebenbürgen has escalated. Hungary has started a fullblown invasion of the Freistaat who now call for our Aid! This is Our opportunity to beat Hungary into submission!
Lets Finish this!
